TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesday: A change of pace

Articles.Content:
11 hours ago, CliftonM said:

Goodbye blender mu import/export plugin.  I'm glad 1.1's going a bit more generic, but I'm not quite sure how I feel about using AssetBundles.  Question: can you provide en example of how we'd use it in the config.  I'm pretty sure it's going to be the same, right?

Don't write it off just yet. I may be able to figure something out: there is a java Unity assetbundle extractor out there and I might be able to use it to RE the format.

11 hours ago, Raptor9 said:

... I think it would help controllability a lot if the player would have more control on how fast the wheels can turn instead of instant left or right...

Have you tried pressing Caps Lock for fine controls? It works wonders for rovers.

1 hour ago, White Owl said:

I love AeroGUI. It is a simply fantastic tool for displaying critical information about atmospheric flight. Great news to see it expanded and added to stock! 

Isn't a cheat displaying pressure and gravity data without a pressure and a gravity meter onboard ?

10 hours ago, Fulbert said:

But the landing gear is already steerable in KSP. At least the small one. You might have to unlock the steering in the drop-menu though.
 

Yes, only the two smallest ones are steerable. The two larger ones are not, which makes it really hard to taxi with large aircraft that use the gear. There is also no unlock steering button in the right click menu. Trust me I've checked!

21 minutes ago, _Astra_ said:

Isn't a cheat displaying pressure and gravity data without a pressure and a gravity meter onboard ?

If you feel that way then you can of course very easily add the required science instruments to your vessel

9 hours ago, federicoaa said:

Are there any pics of the aeroGUI?

Or it's just the arrows pointing from the rocket that tell you velocity, drag, and lift?

It's numeric rather than visual, pic related:

That's from the mod (which is an incredibly useful tool), it might look different in the stock implementation.
I love the whole KSP experience of updates, always something to look forward to (and with squad, we know we wont be let down)

~Wheels that do not grip

Too much when you turn to side

Drift and doughnuts, joy!~

While it's great to hear so many annoyances are getting looked at... are all of them actually necessary to stabilise the Unity 5 release? Once upon a time we hoped for 1.1 by christmas, a month later we're apparently deep in QA while also still having new changes added that haven't even been discussed. Sounds a lot like scope creep, which often leads to projects that never go live...

It is completely ok to launch an update that moves the game to U5 64-bit and fixes "some" problems. You don't have to address everything in one patch, and it's often counter-productive to try. Please remember to breathe, sit back, and make sure you're doing things for a reason 

Not that I don't approve of your work, just that I worry you're trying to handle too much at once. The more changes in a patch, the higher the probability of having errors in it ^^;

1 minute ago, eddiew said:

While it's great to hear so many annoyances are getting looked at... are all of them actually necessary to stabilise the Unity 5 release? Once upon a time we hoped for 1.1 by christmas, a month later we're apparently deep in QA while also still having new changes added that haven't even been discussed. Sounds a lot like scope creep, which often leads to projects that never go live...

It is completely ok to launch an update that moves the game to U5 64-bit and fixes "some" problems. You don't have to address everything in one patch, and it's often counter-productive to try. Please remember to breathe, sit back, and make sure you're doing things for a reason 

Not that I don't approve of your work, just that I worry you're trying to handle too much at once. The more changes in a patch, the higher the probability of having errors in it ^^;

Well, wheels had to be rewritten for the Unity 5 upgrade for some reason someone explained in some devnote some time ago.
I can't wait to see how the new wheels work on my big rover!!!  This should be all sorts of fun!!!

16 hours ago, SQUAD said:

The new PartTools uses Unity AssetBundles rather than .mu files and will therefore allow every standard Unity object to be included in mods. Hopefully this will lead to new and interesting mods after the release of 1.1.

It would be super cool to have a similar feature for GUI for not having to draw all the stuff by hands as that gets more complicated with Unity 5.

Edited January 27, 2016 by Ser

Sooooo we get rid of the 3.5 gig RAM limit, and dynamically load things. 

(Insert Dr. Seuss style poem describing the insane number of mods we're gonna run)

Glad to hear that wheels a rolling along.

Also, the thought that turning off traction control gives me joy.

I must admit that I am vaguely amused by the thought of mods that add spikes to your rover tires, or 'spin-out plumes' if you turn off traction-control.

 

Of course that also gives me images of kerbals bracing a rover against their Minmus base, and trying to fill an over-sized bowl with minus-shavings by making the rover peel-out.

(and then a circle of crest-fallen kerbals sitting in a a hitch-hiker module around this giant bowl, poking at it with spoons with one of them saying 'But I really thought it would taste like mint ice cream!')

Great dev notes! Looking forward to seeing the new wheel mechanics in action.

On that note, would you be able to add some short lived tire tracks and wheel generated dust/ice particles? Would be great when performing Duna donuts and Dres drifting sessions!

1 hour ago, Yakuzi said:

Great dev notes! Looking forward to seeing the new wheel mechanics in action.

On that note, would you be able to add some short lived tire tracks and wheel generated dust/ice particles? Would be great when performing Duna donuts and Dres drifting sessions!

100% agree with tracks and dust, but I say why have them go away? If there is no atmosphere, tracks and footprints should stay for hundreds of millions of years and not be shortly lived. It would be helpful also to know where you have been and where you were traveling from for those long distance rover expeditions  (though waypoints would complete the same purpose) WE COULD MAKE OREGON TRAIL ROADS, THINGS O_O

Keeping in mind though, yes a lot of changes usually results in more bug killing that needs to happen, so maybe chill on this till 1.2

regardless i cant wait for 1.1 

 

Edited January 27, 2016 by fireblade274

3 hours ago, eddiew said:

While it's great to hear so many annoyances are getting looked at... are all of them actually necessary to stabilise the Unity 5 release? Once upon a time we hoped for 1.1 by christmas, a month later we're apparently deep in QA while also still having new changes added that haven't even been discussed. Not that I don't approve of your work, just that I worry you're trying to handle too much at once. The more changes in a patch, the higher the probability of having errors in it ^^;

yey consoles
Can I bother you folks for a quick Duna drift gif?

Really looking forward to playing with wheels that are actually wheels! 
You know how in some places on the terrain there are "seams" which if driven over at speed can do really nasty things to rovers? Do you think the new wheels will deal with those better?

Great Job guys, sounds like you earned that Friday off! 

only thing is;

21 hours ago, SQUAD said:

Felipe devised a plan (a very cunning plan) and simply corrected the phantom torque with an equal and opposite torque.

that's a rather concerning statement. 

Edited January 27, 2016 by katateochi
News about wheels and especially about PartTools are great. Now I'm even more hyped for 1.1.

21 hours ago, SQUAD said:
bizarre bugs such as the one that caused parked wheels to start drifting. We never quite discovered the root cause of the issue, but Felipe devised a plan (a very cunning plan) and simply corrected the phantom torque with an equal and opposite torque.

I'm no programmer, but this is a bit concerning. I hope this is only a temporary solution. It seems to be more of a cheap workaround rather than an actual fix, and I hope this doesn't cause problems later on.

26 minutes ago, Kagame said:

Can I bother you folks for a quick Duna drift gif?

~Duna, land of vast

Sandy, fluffy, red terrain

Spin, happy rover! ~

6 hours ago, eddiew said:

While it's great to hear so many annoyances are getting looked at... are all of them actually necessary to stabilise the Unity 5 release? Once upon a time we hoped for 1.1 by christmas, a month later we're apparently deep in QA while also still having new changes added that haven't even been discussed. Sounds a lot like scope creep, which often leads to projects that never go live...

It is completely ok to launch an update that moves the game to U5 64-bit and fixes "some" problems. You don't have to address everything in one patch, and it's often counter-productive to try. Please remember to breathe, sit back, and make sure you're doing things for a reason 

Not that I don't approve of your work, just that I worry you're trying to handle too much at once. The more changes in a patch, the higher the probability of having errors in it ^^;

OTOH, its very possible that not every software dev that works there has either the experience or the patience to spend the next X months of their programming lives doing nothing but chasing down U5 porting issues.  And even if everyone is working primarily on U5 some squirrel time will make for mentally healthier devs.

23 hours ago, SQUAD said:

more bizarre bugs such as the one that caused parked wheels to start drifting. We never quite discovered the root cause of the issue, but Felipe devised a plan (a very cunning plan) and simply corrected the phantom torque with an equal and opposite torque. Newton would be proud. The wheels now stay in place, which means that vehicles continue to not move as they should.

Ahh, this is how you breed and feed the Krakens in the KSP codebase.
